pr_title: Add returning for insert to analyzer

timeline.message: Add returnvalues and output fields for insert to analyzer
Add returnvalues and output fields for insert to analyzer
Simplify return value part in InsertAnalyzer

timeline.author: mfussenegger

replies.bodyText: AnalyzedInsertStatement is not an AnalyzedRelation so it can't be this. The subQueryRelation would of course work, but i assumed that the subquery relation is not the relation who owns the output field, so this is why I ended with this solution. What I am missing here ?
replies.author: mkleen

replies.bodyText:
Oh I see, I missed that.
Could you add a inline comment about that? We'll need to address that eventually, but given that we did the same for Update I guess it is okay to move along as is for now.
replies.author: mfussenegger

replies.bodyText: Ok, will do. Thanks for the feedback. So, AnalyzedInsertStatement should be a Relation in an ideal world ?
replies.author: mkleen

replies.bodyText:
Currently my thinking is that in an ideal world the Field wouldn't have this relation reference in its current form.
I'm not sure about AnalyzedInsertStatement being a Relation - or changing the hierarchy there in some other form. The focus would be more on changing fields() and outputs (or in this case, the returnValues`, so that only 1 is needed and not both.
But that's something for the future.
replies.author: mfussenegger

timeline.author: mfussenegger

replies.author: mfussenegger

timeline.bodyText:
I'm not sure if we should do the normalization here already.
This is to turn Field into Reference I assume?
In other cases we do this as part of the logical planning via the RelationNormalizer. Maybe you could have a look if it would be possible to also defer this to the RelationNormalizer.
I wouldn't spend too much time on it. I want to change some things about Field and Reference soon anyhow.
timeline.author: mfussenegger

replies.bodyText: CurrentIy we normalize also in the UpdateAnalyzer at the same point. I could extend the RelationNormalizer to also support the AnalyzedInsertStatement. Does this make sense to you ?
replies.author: mkleen

replies.bodyText:
could extend the RelationNormalizer to also support the AnalyzedInsertStatement. Does this make sense to you ?

Yes, but only if it isn't too much effort and doesn't cause other issues.
replies.author: mfussenegger

replies.bodyText: I had a look at RelationNormalizer and I think conceptionally it would be a bit awkward to add  AnalyzedInsertStatement as a non-relational type to the RelationNormalizer. I would leave as it is right now, what do you think ?
replies.author: mkleen

timeline.message: Add returnvalues and output fields for insert to analyzer
Add returnvalues and output fields for insert to analyzer
